i2r.hlt.wrapper
Class TerrierWrapper

java.lang.Object
  i2r.hlt.wrapper.TerrierWrapper

public class TerrierWrapper
extends java.lang.Object

This class is the wrapper on top of terrier API. Use it for the most of IR related needs.

Author:
Parth Gupta (pgupta@dsic.upv.es)

Method Detail

setStopwordRemoval

public void setStopwordRemoval(java.lang.String lang)
Sets the stopword removal and points to the stopwords file at "$terrier_home/share/" location. Make sure that language files is present.

Parameters:
lang - -- should follow the "en", "es" convention

setLanguage

public void setLanguage(java.lang.String lang)

setModelParamC

public void setModelParamC(double c)

getTotIndexedDocs

public long getTotIndexedDocs()

setStemmer

public void setStemmer(java.lang.String lang)
Sets the stemmer environment of the Terrier. Makes an object of the TermPipeline and sets it with the stemmer. The Stemmer is Snowball and the possible laguages are English, Danish, Dutch, German, French, Finnish, Italian, Hugarian, Norwegian, Portuguese, Romanian, Russian, Spanish, Swedish, Turkish

Parameters:
lang - - ISO 639-1 Code of the language (e.g. "en", "es" etc.)

setIndex

public void setIndex(java.lang.String _indexPath,
                     java.lang.String prefix)
Set necessary location of the index with path and prefix

processTerm

public java.lang.String processTerm(java.lang.String term)
Acts as a term pipeline

Parameters:
term -
Returns:
"" if its a stopword or the stemmed output

getResultSet

public ResultSet getResultSet(java.lang.String query,
                              java.lang.String match_model,
                              boolean qe,
                              int N)
                       throws RecognitionException,
                              TokenStreamException,
                              java.io.IOException
This class tries to act as a customized user interface to the terrier in order to get the ranked list for given query and already built index with the specified model with/without query expansion.

Parameters:
query - = query in the String format (Make sure the query is tokenized already)
match_model - = Matching model like [TF_IDF, BM25, InL2, LemurTF_IDF, PL2, DFR_BM25]
qe - = whether to enable QE
Throws:
java.io.IOException
RecognitionException
TokenStreamException

updateCollectionStatistics

public void updateCollectionStatistics()
Updates some index statistics.

                                 throws java.io.IOException
Use UTFTokenizer of terrier to tokenize given String.

Parameters:
s - Input String
Returns:
Tokenized version
Throws:
java.io.IOException

stem

public java.lang.String stem(java.lang.String s)
Stems using the Snowball Stemmer for aforementioned Language in the setStemmer().

Parameters:
s - - term to Stem
Returns:
- Stemmed output

getIDF

public float getIDF(java.lang.String term)
Return the 'IDF' of the 'term'. Calculates based on the formula log(N/df) where N = total documents in the collection.

Parameters:
term -
Returns:

getVector

public TIntFloatHashMap getVector(java.io.File f,
                                  boolean wordCount)
                           throws java.io.IOException
To get the vector of the given document as TF-IDF score or Word Count. Binary Vector can easily be made based on the returned vector.

Parameters:
f - Input File
wordCount -
Returns:
Throws:
java.io.IOException

getVector

public TIntFloatHashMap getVector(int docid,
                                  boolean wordCount)
                           throws java.io.IOException
This method prepares a word count or real valued vector for the input docid. The word count vector is if a term is present with what frequency, while the real vector is the TF-IDF of the terms present in the document.

Parameters:
docid -
wordCount -
Returns:
Throws:
java.io.IOException

                         java.lang.String lang,
                         boolean stopword_removal,
                         boolean stem)
                  throws java.io.IOException

path - = Path to create the index
prefix - = prefix to use for index
collection_type - = Type of the collection

loadDocuments
